abstract: MetLife has emerged as the lead bidder for the American International Group’s Alico life insurance unit, a person briefed on the matter told DealBook, as A.I.G. seeks to sell off the unit to help repay its $182 billion in government aid.
snippet: MetLife has emerged as the lead bidder for the American International Group’s Alico life insurance unit, a person briefed on the matter told DealBook, as A.I.G. seeks to sell off the unit to help repay its $182 billion in government aid.
lead_paragraph: Update | 1:12 p.m. MetLife has emerged as the lead bidder for the American International Group‘s Alico life insurance unit, people briefed on the matter told DealBook, as A.I.G. seeks to sell off the unit to help repay its $182 billion in government aid.

headline.main: MetLife Nears a Deal for A.I.G.’s Alico Unit

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced
